result.execSummary:
The defendant Kody J. Deacy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin(2nd+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kody J. Deacy in court with attorney Paul M Goetz.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls  @ 4:12 pm.  Court has received PSI.  State has received PSI, Atty Goetz has received PSI. State has no correction.  Atty Goetz makes clarification on page 2.  State gives sentencing argument, impose & stay 3 1/2 years prison 1 1/2 year initial confinement  2 years extended supervision,  3 years probation, counseling deemed, absolute sobriety, fulltime employment or enrolled in school, 9 months jail.  Atty Goetz gives sentencing argument.  59 days credit.  Atty Goetz imposed & stay prison sentence but also imposed stay conditional time.  State would stipulate to 59 days credit if revoked. Def. makes statement.  
Court orders 3 years probation impose & stay 3 years prison 1 1/2  years initial confinement  1 1/2  years extended supervision,  costs, DNA sample, $250.00 surcharge, 60 days credit if revoked. 60 days jail, huber privileges. C. no later than  2-26-16 @ 6 pm. AODA & follow through or treatment programs by agent. Maintain Absolute Sobriety, Maintain Fulltime employment or enrolled in school or active finding employment. Def. is eligible for challenge or substance abuse program. Def. advised of firearm & voting rights. 
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Def. advised of postconviction rights. Bond to be returned to poster. Def. to report to Probation tomorrow.
May not possess any controlled substances or prescription drugs without valid prescription.   No use of alcohol.

Defendant Kody J. Deacy in court with attorney Paul M Goetz.  Defendant Kody J. Deacy in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 3:50 p.m. Waiver of prelim and plea and sentencing. Waiver filed. Court reviews waiver and prelim rights. Court finds waiver knowingly and voluntarily made. Binds over. Information filed, copy received. Off record briefly. State advises 2+ enhancer will be deleted as part of agreement, will be asking for PSI. Court grants motion to amend. Atty Goetz agrees. Def agrees. Plea quest. reviewed. Plea to ct 1 as amended - no contest. Constitutional rights, elements, possible penalties reviewed. Atty Goetz satisfied. Court finds Def understands and plea freely & voluntarily made. Factual basis. Court accepts plea and finds guilty of ct 1 as amended. Joint recommendation for PSI report. Court so orders. Report to be completed and distributed to all parties by 2/5/16. Atty Goetz heard on bond. Response by State. Questions by the Court. Discussion regarding bond. Court will lower bond.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 12, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Kody J. Deacy in court via video  with attorney Paul M Goetz.  Defendant Kody J. Deacy in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint received.  Felony charge.  Counsel has not contacted client.  Def is in custody for non-payment of fines.  State request cash bond in amount of $1000.00  Atty Goetz reserve right to argue bond.  Bond set by court.  Issue of bond can be heard later.  Right to preliminary explained to def by counsel.  Court will waive time limit for preliminary however after counsel has talked to def may change  Status conference scheduled for December 21, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
